org.glowa.danube.components.actor.tourism.utilities
Class FormatedFilePrinterWS

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Writer
      java.io.PrintWriter
          org.glowa.danube.components.actor.tourism.utilities.FormatedFilePrinterWS
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable
public class FormatedFilePrinterWS
extends java.io.PrintWriter

Print to a ASCII-File.

This class provides functions to print integer, float, double values in a special format: the field width and precision width may be specified.
All files created by the FormatedFilePrinter will be placed in a common output directory "./modelout/text/rivernetwork". Therefore the filename may not have a absolut path since the file is located relative to the common output directory. The existens of the output directory is guaranteed by a static constructor.

The FormatedFilePrinter extends the java.io.PrintWriter.

All Exceptions generated by the PrintWriter are forwarded by the FormatedFilePrinter.

Version:
1.0 16.09.2002
Author:
Georg Kasper; see also http://www.iawg.de

println

public void println(int val,
                    int length)
print the integer value "val" in a number field with a total length of "length" chars and add a trailing newline.
If "length" is negative the number will be padded with blanks for the right side, else form the left.

print

public void print(double d,
                  int fieldLeng,
                  int rest)
print the double value "d" in a number field with a total length of "fieldLeng" chars and a fraction part with the length of "rest" chars.
If "fieldLeng" is negative the number will be padded with blanks for the right side, else form the left.
If the total field length is to small the number will be enclosed with the brakets <,>.

print

public void print(int val,
                  int fieldLeng)
print the integer value "val" in a number field with a total length of "length" chars.
If "fieldLeng" is negative the number will be padded with blanks for the right side, else form the left. If the total field length is to small the number will be enclosed with the brakets <,>.
